Rising sea level threatens Boston, entire East Coast

The seas from North Carolina to New England are rising faster than the global average, leaving coastal cities vulnerable to flooding, according to a new study. (Globe)

Cranberry industry lobbying to avoid ban

Industry officials are leveraging high-profile support to help keep cranberry juice cocktails off the list of sugary drinks that could soon be banned from schools.
Opinion | Juliette Kayyem

As Egypt is finding out, an emerging democracy requires more than just elections.

Bishops launch a push vs. mandates

The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Boston is joining dioceses across the US in a drive to protest what US bishops consider to be escalating attacks by government on religious liberty.

Social media in play on the field

A number of start-ups are offering Internet platforms to link coaches, parents, and players in youth leagues.
Health

Supersized servings a big concern

Heaping plates of pasta and giant cups of sugary drinks may be good values for the wallet, but they can also be a health hazard, researchers say.

Holograms, 3-D on verge of new era

Amid the resurgence of 3-D in movies and the continued evolution of computers, holography is poised to enter its second act, supporters say.

Tea Party museum set for relaunch

Workers are putting the finishing touches on the Boston Tea Party Ships and Museum, which will open Monday night after 12 years of planning and work.
